content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. explore the world
2. have fun


Constraints:


Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 11:11:40 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As the system, I received a command to browse for fun activities in New York City. Using Google, I searched for "fun activities to do in new york city" and received a list of URLs from the command. Then, I received a command to browse a specific website and gather information about fun activities in New York City. I used the command to browse the website and found that there are many fun activities to do in New York City, including visiting famous landmarks, museums, and galleries, taking boat tours, attending Broadway shows, exploring Central Park, trying different foods in various neighborhoods, going on a pub crawl, and visiting alternative museums such as ARTECHOUSE. Outdoor activities such as riding a jet ski along the Hudson River and cycling over the Brooklyn Bridge are also suggested. The website also recommends staying at mid-range chain hotels or renting an apartment in neighborhoods like Williamsburg, Bushwick, and Harlem, as well as exploring other destinations in the Northeastern U.S. that can be easily reached from New York City. 

I received a command to write a list of activities to do in New York City to a file named "activities_to_do.txt". The list includes visiting the Empire State Building, taking a boat tour, attending a Broadway show, exploring Central Park, trying different foods in various neighborhoods, going on a pub crawl, visiting alternative museums such as ARTECHOUSE, riding a jet ski along the Hudson River, cycling over the Brooklyn Bridge, and visiting famous landmarks, museums, and galleries. I then received a command to execute a shell command to print "Time to start exploring New York City!"

Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b'Time to start exploring New York City!\n'
STDERR:
b''
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b'Time to start exploring New York City!\n'
STDERR:
b''
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: According to the text, there are many activities to do in New York City, including visiting museums such as the American Museum of Natural History, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and the Museum of Modern Art, dining at various restaurants, exploring parks like Central Park and the High Line, attending Broadway shows, and visiting landmarks like the Empire State Building and the National September 11 Memorial & Museum. The text also suggests activities like playing pickleball, shopping at the Harry Potter store, and visiting the House of Cannabis. The website provides a comprehensive guide to essential eats, drinks, culture, parks, and more in New York City. 
 
 Links: ['Go to the content (https://www.timeout.com/newyork/things-to-do/101-things-to-do-in-new-york#main-container)', 'Go to the footer (https://www.timeout.com/newyork/things-to-do/101-things-to-do-in-new-york#site-footer)', 'Terms of Use (https://www.timeout.com/terms-of-use)', 'Privacy Policy (https://www.timeout.com/privacy-notice)', 'News (https://www.timeout.com/newyork/news)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "Now that we have gathered more information about the activities we are interested in, we can use the `write_to_file` command to create a final list of the activities we want to do.",
        "reasoning": "Creating a final list of the activities we want to do will help us stay organized and make sure we don't miss out on anything. Using the `write_to_file` command will allow us to create a file that we can refer to throughout our trip.",
        "plan": "- Review the information we gathered from the websites and the `browse_website` command
- Create a final list of the activities we want to do
- Use the `write_to_file` command to create a file with our final list
- Make sure to include any necessary details such as dates, times, and locations",
        "criticism": "We should be careful not to include too many activities on our list and leave room for flexibility. We should also make sure to prioritize the activities we want to do so we don't miss out on anything.",
        "speak": "Let's use the information we gathered from the websites and the `browse_website` command to create a final list of the activities we want to do. We can use the `write_to_file` command to create a file with our final list."
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "write_to_file",
        "args": {
            "filename": "final_activities_to_do.txt",
            "text": "Final list of activities to do in New York City:
1. Visit the Empire State Building
2. Take a boat tour
3. Attend a Broadway show
4. Explore Central Park
5. Try different foods in various neighborhoods
6. Go on a pub crawl
7. Visit alternative museums such as ARTECHOUSE
8. Ride a jet ski along the Hudson River
9. Cycle over the Brooklyn Bridge
10. Visit famous landmarks, museums, and galleries
11. Play pickleball
12. Shop at the Harry Potter store
13. Visit the House of Cannabis"
        }
    }
}
Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
